main_definition: Individuals or entities who actively participate in adding value, content, resources, or efforts towards a shared goal, project, or body of work.

meanings_and_examples.definition: People who add their ideas and effort to a collaborative project
meanings_and_examples.example: In the open-source software community, programmers are key contributors by writing code and fixing bugs.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Entities that provide financial support or resources for a venture or initiative
meanings_and_examples.example: Donors can be considered as financial contributors to nonprofit organizations aiming at social welfare.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Authors or creators who contribute written works, articles, books, etc.
meanings_and_examples.example: Writers and poets are content contributors in the publishing industry by writing novels, stories, or poetry collections.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Participants in a research study or experiment
meanings_and_examples.example: Study participants who provide data for medical research can be seen as valuable contributors to scientific progress.
